title: "Letter of credit" term; "confirmed credit"
context: ยง490:2-325 &ldquo;Letter of credit&rdquo; term; &ldquo;confirmed credit&rdquo;. (1) Failure of the buyer seasonably to furnish an agreed letter of credit is a breach of the contract for sale. (2) The delivery to seller of a proper letter of credit suspends the buyer&rsquo;s obligation to pay. If the letter of credit is dishonored, the seller may on seasonable notification to the buyer require payment directly from him. (3) Unless otherwise agreed the term &ldquo;letter of credit&rdquo; or &ldquo;banker&rsquo;s credit&rdquo; in a contract for sale means an irrevocable credit issued by a financing agency of good repute and, where the shipment is overseas, of good international repute. The term &ldquo;confirmed credit&rdquo; means that the credit must also carry the direct obligation of such an agency which does business in the seller&rsquo;s financial market. [L 1965, c 208, ยง2-325; HRS ยง490:2-325]
